description.general: The s1kd-newupf tool creates a new S1000D data update file for two specified issues of a CIR data module. Changes to items between the source and target issues of the CIR are recorded in the resulting UPF, along with update instructions.

option.name: -$, --issue <issue>
option.description: Specify which issue of S1000D to use. Currently supported issues are: 5.0 (default), 4.2, 4.1

option.name: -@, --out <path>
option.description: Save the new update file to <path>. If <path> is an existing directory, the update file will be created in it instead of the current directory. Otherwise, the update file will be saved as the filename <path> instead of being automatically named.

option.name: -%, --templates <dir>
option.description: Use XML template in the specified directory instead of the built-in template. The template must be named update.xml in the directory <dir>, and must conform to the default S1000D issue of this tool (5.0).

option.name: -~, --dump-templates <dir>
option.description: Dump the built-in XML template to the specified directory.

option.name: -d, --defaults <file>
option.description: Specify the .defaults file name.

option.name: -f, --overwrite
option.description: Overwrite existing file.

option.name: -h, -?, --help
option.description: Show help/usage message.

option.name: -q, --quiet
option.description: Do not report an error when the file already exists.

option.name: -v, --verbose
option.description: Print the file name of the newly created data update file.

option.name: --version
option.description: Show version information.

option.name: <SOURCE>
option.description: The source (original) issue of the CIR data module.

option.name: <TARGET>
option.description: The target (updated) issue of the CIR data module.

option.name: --dtdload
option.description: Load the external DTD.

option.name: --huge
option.description: Remove any internal arbitrary parser limits.

option.name: --net
option.description: Allow network access to load external DTD and entities.

option.name: --noent
option.description: Resolve entities.

option.name: --parser-errors
option.description: Emit errors from parser.

option.name: --parser-warnings
option.description: Emit warnings from parser.

option.name: --xinclude
option.description: Do XInclude processing.

option.name: --xml-catalog <file>
option.description: Use an XML catalog when resolving entities. Multiple catalogs may be loaded by specifying this option multiple times.

description.defaultsFile: Refer to s1kd-newdm for information on the .defaults file which is used by all the s1kd-new* commands.
